page.title: 10Donibristle Airfield
page.content: The airfield was built in{1917}when the Earl of Moray was persuaded by his son to donate some land for experimental work.The airfield soon became a{Royal Naval Air Service} repair base,and rapidly became busy. The aerodrome had a special railway to it from the custom built pier at the East Ness of Inverkeithing,right up to the airfield itself.Engines in need of repair were transported to Donibristle in this way.In{1918}this airfield became an RAF station. In the Second World War Donibristle served two purposes.It was a shore base and also a well staffed Royal Naval Aircraft Repair yard.Donibristle played a large part in the war,as at least{7000 aircraft}were serviced, equipped and despatched between 1939 and 1945. The area is now covered in part by the Hillend Industrial estate.
